TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed XmlSerializationReadCallback extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Function XmlSerializationReadCallback() As Object
type XmlSerializationReadCallback = delegate of unit -> obj

Docs.summary: Delegate used by the class for deserialization of types from SOAP-encoded, non-root XML data.
Docs.returns: The object returned by the callback.

remarks.format:
## Remarks During initialization, the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure dynamically generates and compiles a temporary class for deserialization derived from the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> class. During this process, the .NET Framework generates read methods that implement the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReadCallback> delegate. It does so for certain mappings between .NET Framework types and XML data types that are serialized through SOAP-encoded XML and are not root elements. Then, as necessary, a read method is called during deserialization.
Do not directly create instances of the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReadCallback> class.
SOAP encoding is described in Section 5 of the SOAP 1.1 specification.
